abstract: Human Rights Watch report suggests Saudi Arabia has fired American-made cluster munitions in civilian areas of Yemen; notes use is banned by international treaty and may also break United States law; report, if proven true, could place new pressure on US for its support of Saudi Arabia in Yemen civil war.

headline.print_headline: Report Suggests Use of American Cluster Munitions in Yemen May Break U.S. Law
headline.main: New Report of U.S.-Made Cluster Bomb Use by Saudis in Yemen

keywords.value: Arms Control and Limitation and Disarmament
keywords.name: subject

snippet: The report by Human Rights Watch included photos of bombs that did not explode, indicating they failed reliability standards required for U.S. export.
lead_paragraph: The report by Human Rights Watch included photos of bombs that did not explode, indicating they failed reliability standards required for U.S. export.
